reviews.content: It was so good to see Dr. Schneider.....we felt lost without her.  We were pleased with the administrative details....staff is friendly and professional....we were at the Merritt Island office.

If I could give them no stars I would. The clinic is a MESS. The staff is unprofessional. We made an appointment to see Dr. Kobobel. When we got there they told us Dr. Kobobel doesn't work that day. So they had the Nurse Practitioner see us. Not a medical doctor. I worked in the medical field for 6 years. This is by far the worst clinic I've ever been to.

Absolute nightmare.  Avoid this place at all costs.  This is the poorest run medical establishment I have ever experienced.  Expect to sit on hold for 20 mins with a simple question, likely be hung up on multiple times if your call is answered at all.  No apologies just attitude.  They close for random things and at "lunch" each day which has a vague start and end time.  I gave them many chances to improve thinking it may be an isolated experience, it was not.  You have been warned.

The Brevard Family walk-in clinic in both Merritt Island and Rockledge have lowered the standards of health care in the Brevard Co Community. My visits to both offices have resulted in observing low quality care, attention, and respect for myself and other patients. . Staff portrays a rude and unprofessional disposition over the phone and in person and Dr's have misplaced my records and failed to follow through with important referrals with out any follow up unless I aggressively pursue it.. My family and I have chosen to discontinue care with this facility in search of professional competent quality care.

New to Merritt Island I was looking for a primary Doctor.  First my sample was lost and then the billing office was not helpful and I was charged for something they lost in transit to the lab.  I would not recommend.

I recently moved to Cocoa and my husband and I were looking for a new family physician close by. We chose Dr. Kobobel's office because they are close and take our insurance. First of all, I tried 3 times to get an appointment. The first time they didn't have me on the schedule, although I had come in to make my appointment and had a hand written appointment card. I rescheduled, only to be called and asked to move my appointment again because the PA scheduled to do my physical as taking some time off (*wait...what?*) so once again I had to reschedule. Then, I had to reschedule myself, which was not the fault of the office but would have been unnecessary had I been able to go to my original appointment. When I finally went, my exam was thorough, so no complaints there. However, I requested that an explanation of reason be included with one of my prescription refills because the insurance company sometimes balks at the amount, because its migraine medication, and I need it often. She didn't do that, and then the office called to tell me I had to come in again because the pharmacy was questioning the amount of my meds. Now my husband went for a physical and was told they would schedule him a routine colonoscopy and let him know when and where. That never happened either. This doctor's office needs to get their act together. I'm thinking seriously about driving the hour and a half to go see our original physician. . Update: still can't get referrals and refills on prescriptions. Filing a formal complaint with the AMA.

Really horrible experience with Dr. Kobobel and this office.  He came across as very condescending and arrogant towards myself and my 14 yr old daughter.  In addition, the lab tech screwed up and we had to turn around while on the way home to go back and give more blood.  Very traumatic experience for my child in large part to the bedside manner of Kobobel and his staff.  My family and I will be switching primary care providers immediately.

If i could sumbit with no stars, I WOULD! This is the worst Dr's office I've ever been to. Check in and tell them you have insurance and they try to tell you a pre-employment physical is going to run you $150. !?!?!? Finally figure that mess out with KAROL, the 12 yr old who just graduated medical assisting school behind the front desk, and move on to visit #2 which was suppose to be a follow up. "Ma'am your appt was an hour ago". Same 12 yr old who tried to overcharge me also booked my appt and told me the wrong time. Sat in the waiting room for a hour and a half until all the people who were there before me got seen. Then sat in the patient room for 30 minutes until someone, anyone came in and said "the DR isn't going to see you today because your bloodwork came back inconclusive " No, your staff messed up while drawing my blood because when this was redone the same day, they took a different blood sample. Reschedule to have another followup once the labs come back. Visit #3... Followup shows heart murmur didn't correct itself and we'll need to see a Cardiologist and follow up in 2 wks. Cardiologist appt is scheduled with KAROL, because KAROL is the only person working behind the desk and make sure to double check times and dates with her while putting them in my agenda. Well, today was my echocardiogram appt..... Visit #4. I was told and KAROL even wrote it down on an appt card for 1230. I received a call a little after 1130 stating I missed my appt. This office has drawn out this process over the span of a month, which has caused me to miss a deadline for a job i was applying for, and in return caused me to miss out on an increase in pay for my family. These people should be ashamed of themselves!!! And to make matters worse, when I called the office and explained all the above, the woman on the other line said "well we called yesterday evening to confirm but didn't receive an answer." Really? Maybe I didn't answer because I work a 12 hr overnight shift. She says "well did you want to reschedule or....." How can this shit hole continue to run!? I'm sure they've had to have scammed people out of money and I'm sure they've pissed some people off more than me. This place is a joke, save your breath and find another place to go. And if you do continue to go here. Do business with ANYONE other than KAROL. She's the worst.

DO NOT GO HERE.  They say they are a walk in clinic, but when you go in they tell you that all of the appointments for the rest of the day are booked.  When I walked up to see the receptionist I had my license and insurance ready and handed them to her and said "this is my first time here."  Her response to me was "ok, have you been here before?"  They say they reserve one spot per hour for walk ins, but obviously that's not true if they are allowing people to just book them in advance.

We waited hours and ended up walking out.. All we needed was a prescription to stop smoking. . I wouldn't recommend this 'walk in clinic' to anyone. . Please beware. . If I could give zero stars I would.
Walked in to for a sick visit said they were booked. Not a "walk-in" clinic if both the Rocklege and Merritt Island offices are booked for next two days. False advertisement.

Do not come here!. Jackie Xavier PA saw my daughter age 12 last week for a UTI.  I was not happy with her bedside manner.  She was not friendly and was short with me when I asked questions.  A few days later I called because my daughter was not tolerating the Augmentin that she prescribed.  The right thing to do would have been to prescribe an alternative medication but I was told I had to bring my daughter in to be seen again!  The urine culture results were available.  Why not just call in a replacement antibiotic.  My daughter was suffering and it was not her fault she could not tolerate the Augmentin and now I have to bring her back in for another $100 to see a PA who clearly needs a new profession.  Your walk in clinic is only out to make money and not help patients.

I am disappointed by my previous experience. This particular day the staff had some type of party or meeting and I felt like I was being pushed through so they could close the doors.  When I arrived the receptionist was confused about my copay/insurance for a physical which should have been fully covered.  My husband who came in earlier that day for the same thing was charged (same insurance) and I had to ask them why he was charged and why we have different payment amounts.  Apparently they do not double check insurance within the family, so one of the most important jobs in the office isn't being done - insurance verification!. I went to a room and got all the vitals and a tech told me he saw my husband earlier that day. Hello HIPAA Laws!  Lawsuit waiting to happen!  He clearly did not abide by these laws because he was sharing some private information with me.  Not that I wasn't happy to hear the good news, but that is patient confidentiality, and what if I hadn't been his wife, but an ex, or someone who just shares the same last name!  Then, a few minutes later some man barged in the room upset with the tech that I was in the room because I was another PA's patient. He was very rude and didn't even apologize for interrupting.  As I switched rooms again the whole place was getting ready for this activity afterwards, it seemed very unprofessional and uncomfortable because I felt like I shouldn't be there. By the time I saw my PA she did a good job, but again I felt like she had some where better to be.  I couldn't get out of there fast enough because I felt unwelcome and interrupting their office party.  That's exactly what this place is, an unprofessional party.  Dr Kobobel, you have some serious "trimming" to do with "your" staff.  . Thanks for nothing, my husband and I will be looking for a new doctors office this week!

Don't go here. I got shingles.   Also had lymph node swelling and said he would prescribe antibiotic which I never got.  I called back numerous times for two days and never got antibiotic. Then they wanted me to come back in.  I believe staff never communicated with Dr properly.

I was trying to set this place up as my PCP, but have quickly figured out that would be a mistake. Now this review is about the clinic as a whole, not necessarily for Dr Kobobel. He seems OK. My experience so far is that they have the WORST service of any medical office I have EVER been to. On two separate occasions I have tried to get my blood pressure meds refilled and called in and went to their refill selection. I have had to leave a message because I have NEVER had anyone answer the phone at this clinic. . I left a message with my name, phone number and the med that needed refilled. That was early in the morning. I never received a call back. It took me two days to finally get someone and then they proceed to tell me that they would refill it this time but they needed to get blood tests done. That's their way of getting that extra charge from you and your insurance. . Now jump ahead 30 days later and the EXACT same thing. I have tried to get in touch with them with no luck. Called first thing in the morning. No answer. Left my message and nothing. I called back and no answer again. I tried calling again at 5:45 pm and still no answer. They don't close until around 8 pm. This is ridiculous. I have not received a call about the tests or a return call about my refill now for two times in a row. . I will be looking for a new primary care provider and I suggest you do the same.. 1/20/14---An Update---There is also a place on their Facebook account where you can review them so I put a review up about how terrible the service was and my experience of this location. Then who ever manages their Facebook page gets on and makes a comment saying that I had been harassing the staff (I guess the few times I called and left messages on their voicemail asking for my prescription refilled or for someone to call me back is a little too harassing) and then another post saying that they had reported me to the local authorities and to remove the post or they would file legal charges against me. I responded accordingly and they removed their part of the posts. I supposed you can only review their clinic if it's a positive review!!. New Update: 10/14/2016: Haven't been back but look at all of the reviews since my first one!! Wow!! It looks like this place just keeps it up. Be very skeptical of a place that makes you make MULTIPLE appointments. That seems to be their MO. Hit your insurance and get your copay multiple times. Keep going. People will be on to you folks in no time.

My blood results showed my Ferritin level 8. I am a heart patient (2 stent surgeries and open heart surgery). It is critical my iron stays up as I experience chest pains and shortness of breath as the levels drop. . I was under a hematologist care for seven years in TN who would give me iron or blood transfusions as needed. Now here in Merritt Island I needed the iron perception (special iron that absorbs in the upper intestines). It was Friday when I got the blood results so I had to wait until Monday. I was anxious because I have been hospitalized five times for my heart from anemia. .  ~  Monday morning 8:30. Brevard Walk-in Clinic. Explained to the nurse practitioner  Julie Canada, ARNP-CI was worried about having a heart attack..     ~   The nurse and doctor wrote down the name of the special iron. She could not find it in her med book but we found it onGoogle. The doctor told me should would call in the prescription  to CVS (next door)..      ~  Mon 12:30 I go to CVS and wait in line to get prescription iron. It was never called in..      ~  Mon 1:00 I go back to Brevard Walk in Clinic, wait in line, and explain to the receptionist I need the prescription iron ASAP. She wrote it down. I begin having chest tightening..    ~    Mon 3:45 I go back to CVS and wait in line 20 minutes and am told there is no prescription iron from your doctor..    ~    Mon  4:00 I call Brevard Walk in Clinic and ask why the iron was not called in. I was told they would give Julie the message she was with another patient. I explained I was worried about my heart. I was told they would call it in..     ~   Mon. 4:20 I call CVS. There is no prescription..     ~   Tuesday 8:30 am. I call Brevard Walk-in Clinic (I am angry). I ask why the iron was prescription was not called in. I was told they did not know but would pass on the message. I responded I had called several times and come in twice and still no one called in the prescription and I am worried about having a heart attack. I was put on hold for a nurse. I repeated all the information to the nurse. She put me on hold. After several minutes waiting the nurse asked me what the name of the iron wass. (I watched two people write it in my chart) she said they could not find it..     ~   Tue 12:30 I call CVS THERE IS STILL NO PRESCRIPTION! .    ~    Tues. 1:00 I call Brevard Walk in Clinic and ask why the iron was not called in (REALLY ANGRY NOW). I was put on hold. Someone picked up the phone and asked if I wanted B-12. I said NO I NEED IRON. IShe asked me to clam down!!! I explained it was  Integra iron. She asked me to hold. Someone else came on the line and said they were calling it while I was on the phone. I waited. They said it was called in..     ~   1:40 I call CVS and ask if they have a prescription called in. They said no.. I am posting this on Tuesday at 6:43pm. I am still alive but my chest is hurting and I am very short of breath. I hope to live another day so I can try again to get this prescription. I was considering making Dr Jasen Kobobel my primary care doctor. in fact I had an appointment with him on Wednesday to talk about it.   Not any more.  . I guess the five or six different people I explain I was worried about my heart must not have believed me. I can't imagine how this many phone calls didn't get a response.Do people just not care or are they that unorganized?

I went to their Merritt Island location early in the morning and was told they had no openings but that I could be seen in their Rockledge location later in the day. The receptionist called the other location and made an appointment for me for late afternoon. I showed her my insurance card. She called a supervisor to verify that my insurance would cover the visit. She assured me it would. I was sick, but waited all day then managed to drive a half-hour to the Rockledge location even though it was out of the way. When I arrived, they told me they did not accept my insurance. They called a supervisor, who came out and in a loud and extremely rude manner stated they would not take my insurance and I would have to give them $125 in cash. I waited all day for nothing when I could have located another doctor, but by then it was too late. I called the receptionist back at the Merritt Island office and she did not even offer an apology. I spoke with her supervisor who was extremely curt, unsympathetic and condescending. I would not recommend this practice to anyone. Very poor customer service.

This is not a medical clinic. It is a scam artist. I walked in with back pain I would rate a 9+. They took my history and some bloodwork. When I saw Kobobel he tried to set up tests and a physical that had nothing to do with my back pain (a well woman exam?!?!) and when I asked about my back pain he said I would have to set up another appointment because this was just a physical.  He was scamming the insurance policy language which allowed 100% coverage for physicals. As I walked out in pain he had the gall to try to sell me a membership to his gym!!  He should be reported to the Board.  There should be a negative star option.

Had a bad case of influenza. I was so dizzy and had such a high fever I had to get a family member to drive me. I walked in, clearly could see and hear I was sick. I stood waiting at counter for nearly 10 minutes until the two ladies stopped laughing and carrying on about some personal thing. Finally, she opens the glass and just looks at me and then says "Do you have an appointment?" I told her I did not and needed to be seen. She replied with "you need to have an appointment in order to be seen." I was somewhat taken by this as right out front on the sign and on the door it says "WALK-IN CLINIC." . She didn't even offer to schedule me an appointment, instead she tells me to go down the street to the other one. I was completely new to the area and didn't know where the 'other one down the street' was. She handed me a list, of which we drove to the closest one to fined out it had been closed down for quite some time. Ended at Premier Urgent Care. They were great.

Sorry there isn't a half star and the star is only for the PA Michelle Williams. The professionalism for the staff is sorry. First impression was they aren't focused on customer care. They are focused on visiting with each other, laughing chatting then they will get to you if they feel they want to. My husband had flu back before thanksgiving and they did test to verify this but after calling several times never getting to talk to anyone and leaving many messages we finally got a call back to tell us he had the flu but couldn't tell us what type "they can't give that info over the phone". Then we both came in in January with a virus and a culture was taken and medicine prescribed and again no return calls. I had a inhaler prescribed but had to have a pre-auth done for insurance. The pharmacy apologized for the delay but the office had to get the authorization for it. Thankfully my husbands insurance didn't need an auth so I could use his. I thought a busy season for flu and virus I'll let it go. Then was there for a surgery clearance and the PA was worried about a EKG and ordered a ultrasound done a few days later at their other clinic. I was told if I didn't hear anything within a week to call. No surprise I had to call no answer. I repeatedly called and the doctors office doing my surgery was calling. No response. I had to call and demand testing because I was within days of my surgery which was a month after starting to get clearance. At this point being worried something was wrong with my heart! Finally! Having to threaten getting my attorney involved my surgeon got the results two days before my surgery. All was okay but test results were poor quality making reading the report difficult and was on the first fax that they claimed they never received. Then I received a call from the pharmacy my inhaler was ready for pickup?! I think they found the pre-auth while looking for test results. Glad I didn't have major breathing problems from January's visit and that was needed. And the latest! I have a new primary care physician and needing another surgery. They were contacting BFWC for my records so that they didn't have to redo unnecessary test. They struggled to get them from them. They worked a week trying to get them. I was sitting in my new doctors office for an hour with them calling them telling them I was their for my appointment and they didn't have the requested information. They got it but the nurse and doctor said they were so unprofessional. Sad when another doctors office makes a comment on how poor Brevard Family Walk-in Clinic office staff is. BFWC needs to wake up, they are setting themselves up for a major lawsuit.
